New Records: Karl-Anthony Towns became the last Knicks player since Patrick Ewing to collect over 30 points and 20 rebounds in multiple games in a single season.
Key Match Events: Karl-Anthony Towns finished with 31 points and 21 rebounds.
Mikal Bridges tallied 27 points on 12 of 17 from the floor.
Josh Hart recorded a triple-double with 15 points, 14 rebounds, and 12 assists.
Cameron Payne helped pace the offense with 9 assists and 3 steals.
Colin Sexton finished with 25 points on 10 of 13 shooting and 4 of 5 from beyond the arc.
Jordan Clarkson scored 25 points off the bench for the Jazz.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York Knicks won their ninth straight game.
The Knicks are now just 0.5 games behind the Atlantic Division-leading Boston Celtics.
